content.description: Climb the entire wall! Climb a tricky thin dihedral up to a steep and reachy bulge to gain access to the head wall then contiue all the way up. Continue up the face until it narrows to a steep pillar. Climb the arete of the pillar to an anchor. Beware on the descent, have the appropriate rope length.
content.location: 20 feet down and right of Leaving the Nest.

content.description: Named by a terrified hobit mexicana after it was freshly bolted and not so clean. The route has since cleaned up and is a nice warm up.
content.location: The start of this route is deep in the chasm on the very far left side of the wall. Climb up a corner to a right facing flake. Climb and continue up a right facing flake/corner.

content.description: The obvious crack on the left side of the wall. Great climbing with varied movement.
content.location: Up the Chasm, Start down and right of This is Bullocks on pockets. Climb up a steep awkward bulge to gain access to the crack and enjoy the rest.

content.description: From a base of a twisted tree and brush start up a face with thin pockets and sidepulls with a small bulge then continue up the face to anchor.
content.location: 20 feet to the right of Bohemian Club. On a platform of tree and brush.

content.description: Climb the right most flake on the wall. Up a pumpy roof to a plated face with great patina edges and cracks to an anchor at a good ledge above. The crack above the ledge is a great handcrack dihedral that goes at 5.10a.
content.location: The right most route of the wall. Starts on a flake that goes to a small roof/bulge.

content.description: Climbed the morning after the wake of Flyin' Bryan McCray. RIP
content.location: Located above mushroom trip up the obvious dihedral.

content.description: A thin testpiece up a masterful slab/ vertical face. Cruxy the whole way.
content.location: Up the center of the prominent white water streak.

content.description: A great route, up the long sustained face. Staying close to the water streak but remaining always on the right of it. A good warm up.
content.location: Same first bolt as Dancin' with Moloch, except continue up straight up a bulge then meander your way up the sustained head wall.

content.description: The Owls Den is a relatively new wall up and left of Red Springs gully. The routes are tall and the climbing is thin and delicate. Bring a 70m rope, for safety. A 60 will barely make some of the routes but to be sure bring a longer rope. The climbing is new so the holds can be fragile. Otherwise the routes are very nice.
